sys_metadata_link.payload:
true
A Problem Manager can configure common settings for Problem Management.

Two main areas are:

  • whether a closed problem can be re-analyzed (reopened) or a closed problem task can be re-assessed (reopened) and which roles can reopen them
  • whether the Accept Risk action moves a problem to the Closed state or to the Resolved state
]]>
true system_properties_ui.do?sysparm_title=Problem Management Properties&sysparm_category=Problem State Transition Properties, Problem Task State Transition Properties, Problem Related List Properties,Knowledge Related Properties 3 1 false true A problem manager can configure the Problem Management properties. The properties determine:

  • whether a closed problem can be reanalyzed (reopened) or a closed problem task can be reassessed (reopened) and which roles can reopen the problem or the problem task
  • whether the Accept Risk action moves a problem to the Closed state or to the Resolved state
  • whether a closed problem can create problem tasks
  • whether to cancel open problem tasks when a problem is closed
  • the Knowledge base that is used to create new Known Error articles from a problem
  • the related task records that are moved when a problem is marked as a duplicate of another problem
  • the related task records to track as fixes for the problem (for example, change requests, defects, enhancements, or releases). When all the related fixes are completed or canceled, the problem coordinator is notified
Note:

If you change the default knowledge base in which the known error articles are saved, ensure that the Problem Coordinator role has permission to create an article in that knowledge base.
